We want to help put more women on the road to Financial Independence Through Entrepreneurship. Join the FITE!
* We'll match up to 3,000 loans.

teams.name: Intel Small Things Challenge
teams.loan_because: Every small, individual action can make a big difference -- especially if millions participate. A modest micro-loan will give an entrepreneur a hand-up to start a new business and provide for his or her family.
teams.description:
Intel is the corporate sponsor of the Small Things Challenge. The company is providing financial support as well as providing opportunities throughout the year to increase global awareness for the issues addressed by the Small Things Challenge – providing opportunities so children in developing countries can attend primary school and their parents can earn higher incomes.
The Intel Small Things Challenge builds upon Intel’s 40 years of active involvement in education. The company is again investing about $100 million in education in 2009. Over the last decade, Intel has invested over $1 billion and Intel employees have donated more than 2 million hours towards improving education in 50 countries.  
Individuals can provide support and find more information about the Small Things Challenge – including the online petition and a video featuring musicians and actors who support the cause – at www.smallthingschallenge.com.

teams.name: Luke Kay Rainbow
teams.loan_because:
Luke Kay’s Rainbow Vacuum is the most advanced cleaning system in the world. From the use of water as the filter to the genius of its patented separator, all the way to the advanced brushless motor, with the Rainbow, you can feel secure in the knowledge that you own the best product on the market.

Proven to collect 99.99% of dust and dirt from carpets and allergens from the air, the Rainbow is simply as good as it gets. Certified by the Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America, the Association of Home Appliance Manufacturers, and the Carpet and Rug Institute, this product is the only cleaning system trusted by Boeing, NASA, dozens of leading universities, hundreds of major hotels, and millions of happy customers worldwide.

The manufacturers are so sure you’ll love the Rainbow, they’re offering the best warranty out there: a 4-year limited warranty on Rainbow Cleaning System, and an 8-year limited warranty on Rainbow motor/electronic control module.

It’s really very simple. You and your family deserve the healthiest possible environment in your home, and Luke Kay’s Rainbow is the cleaning system to get the job done. Take a look at the product specifications and add-on details to see how you can best utilize and optimize the Rainbow Vacuum for your home.

teams.name: David Galper
teams.loan_because:
Entrepreneur David Galper is familiar with launching and growing businesses. He founded and served as president of two tech start-ups prior to launching his own venture in 2003. As digital music downloads became more popular, Galper became the co-founder of Ruckus Network, a legal digital entertainment service and social networking site for colleges, their students and alumni. Galper co-founded the network with Vince Han. Galper and Han local Boston entrepreneurs, were able to identify quickly that there was a business opportunity in allowing people, especially the student population, to download digital music legally. Besides serving on the Board of Directors for Ruckus, Galper also spearheaded the marketing and management of the business by serving as Vice President of Marketing. He also held the position of Vice President of Corporate Development and handled licensing content and the development of strategic partnerships to monetize the base of Ruckus users. Ruckus was eventually acquired by Total Music, a joint venture of Sony BMG and Universal Music Group. During his time there, Galper was able to grow Ruckus by successfully securing funding and negotiating multiple profitable agreements with over 80 colleges and universities for Ruckus’s services.


Before becoming an entrepreneur and becoming involved in his own ventures, David was a  Technology & Innovation Management consultant at Arthur D. Little. While working at Arthur D. Little, David helped multiple businesses launch and worked with the research and development teams of both start-ups and Fortune 100 companies to complete market research for their new technologies and develop their first partnerships and sales. David Galper also held a position at Idealab where he was Director of Business Development for one of the leading technology incubators. After Galper founded Ruckus, he continued to develop and expand the company as an "Entrepreneur-In-Residence" (EIR) at Battery Ventures.

Galper graduated with a B.A. in economics and environmental studies from Brandeis University and an M.B.A. from the MIT Sloan School of Management. He currently resides in Massachusetts and enjoys playing hockey and watching the Redsox.

teams.name: Premiere Environmental
teams.loan_because:
Premiere Environmental’s device is proven to eliminate 99.99% of pollutants contributing to poor air quality. Certified by the Association of Home Appliance Manufacturers (AHAM), the Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America (AAFA), and the Air Resource Board, the product complies with all ozone emissions limits and electrical safety regulations. Built for a lifetime of use, the product is the result of years of innovation, inspiration, passion, and determination. Current users include Boeing, NASA, major hotels, leading universities, and millions of families in 95 countries around the world.

Only Premiere Environmental’s patented system uses a state-of-the-art filtration system that cleans indoor environments naturally, without relying on hazardous chemicals that can make the problem worse. Built for a lifetime of use, the product combines cutting edge technology with the cleansing power of nature to clean your home or office like no other system can.

teams.name: 30 days 30 poems
teams.loan_because: It's November, the month of gratitude.  In thanks for what we have, we give to those who need.
teams.description: Friends of Jean will enjoy a poem a day for the month of November, 2013.  30 poems in 30 days.  If you think a poem is worth 85 cents, then in a month you will have received 25 dollars worth of words.  Please choose a Kiva effort to support with a twenty-five dollar micro loan.  The best news is that your money will hopefully be repaid to you and, with your dividend, you can support a new KIVA effort.  I've started with the first loan.  You can follow suit.  So many of you have thanked me for my poems when I did Advent or Lenten stretches.  Let's turn our thanks into a tangible form of giving and grace. 30 poems in 30 days for 25 dollars.  A bargain.  A way to change someone's life.

teams.loan_because: 1.5 billion people still lack electricity. Only a global solar explosion can change that and end poverty.
teams.description: We know if you really want to fight poverty, you start with distributed renewable power – harnessing the sun in your own backyard! teams.name: Redwood Prep
teams.loan_because: we live in a world that is increasingly interconnected. It is important that children understand and take their place as active and contributing members of the communities to which they belong. We share Charles Haynes’ view, “Developing student’s hearts, is what educators are called to do. Each and every small act of honesty, service, responsibility, and compassion that adults encourage daily in children – and model consistently in their own lives – helps create moral and civic habits of the heart that instill in children the courage to care.”
teams.description:
Our team and school embraces five core values that reflect the mission and vision of our learning community.  We believe these core values to be essential components of an optimal learning environment. 
1. High expectations for academic excellence
2. A focus on classroom, school, local, national, and global community
3. An emphasis on individual and social responsibility
4. Collaborative and collective leadership
5. Well-rounded educational opportunities
Our school motto is borrowed from our hero, Margaret Mead, "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful citizens can change the world. Indeed it is the only thing that ever has."

teams.loan_because: It's November, the month of gratitude.  In thanks for what we have, we give to those who need.
teams.description: Friends of Jean will enjoy a poem a day for the month of November, 2013.  30 poems in 30 days.  If you think a poem is worth 85 cents, then in a month you will have received 25 dollars worth of words.  Please choose a Kiva effort to support with a twenty-five dollar micro loan.  The best news is that your money will hopefully be repaid to you and, with your dividend, you can support a new KIVA effort.  I've started with the first loan.  You can follow suit.  So many of you have thanked me for my poems when I did Advent or Lenten stretches.  Let's turn our thanks into a tangible form of giving and grace. 30 poems in 30 days for 25 dollars.  A bargain.  A way to change someone's life.

teams.name: Intel Small Things Challenge
teams.loan_because: Every small, individual action can make a big difference -- especially if millions participate. A modest micro-loan will give an entrepreneur a hand-up to start a new business and provide for his or her family.
teams.description:
Intel is the corporate sponsor of the Small Things Challenge. The company is providing financial support as well as providing opportunities throughout the year to increase global awareness for the issues addressed by the Small Things Challenge – providing opportunities so children in developing countries can attend primary school and their parents can earn higher incomes.
The Intel Small Things Challenge builds upon Intel’s 40 years of active involvement in education. The company is again investing about $100 million in education in 2009. Over the last decade, Intel has invested over $1 billion and Intel employees have donated more than 2 million hours towards improving education in 50 countries.  
Individuals can provide support and find more information about the Small Things Challenge – including the online petition and a video featuring musicians and actors who support the cause – at www.smallthingschallenge.com.

teams.name: Candice O'Denver
teams.loan_because:
I am an innovator in the practical application of philosophy as a means to benefit all. I invented Balanced View, a standardized education in the nature of mind used throughout the world. Balanced View's unique methodology applies algorithms to reach the consistent result of the beneficial empowerment of mind, speech, body, qualities and activities. Comprehensive order becomes spontaneously obvious through recognizing intelligence as inexhaustibly open in a vast space that is not restricted by the body.

When I was 7, a Bermuda neighbor read to me "Awareness Nakedly Seeing" from the Oxford University translation of "The Tibetan Book of the Dead". The clear perspective of mind as an inexhaustible open intelligence was newly invigorated in me upon hearing this important text. It gave me courage to continue in my firmly held belief that everything is beneficial by nature. I found no distinction between Tibetan timeless awareness and the Christian God that was so important to my family. I learned that each culture has its own system for bringing out the best in people and that each is a perfect fit for that particular culture. I felt a strong urgency to bring unity to the people of the world through a standardized means of bringing out the best in people.

In Bermuda, European Catholic pageantry and British royals were blended with celebratory Caribbean Christianity and early steel drum music, the roots of reggae, rapped out on large discarded oil cans. Every night, the sound filled the air from nightfall until 2am becoming the vibration of the Caribbean countries and their people, including me.

Although the time period of the 50's was after World War II, Jewish people were not permitted entry to the country or its lodging through a variety of devious means. My parents gave refuge to visitors and immigrants who were not allowed in Bermuda, giving all six of their children a rich background in international community and friendship.

I studied in a Yale mathematics program for gifted children. At the age of 18, I attended a UCLA international program for young philosophers where I focused on the pragmatic application of philosophy to be of immediate, permanent benefit. Bypassing undergraduate school, I was accepted into and completed graduate school, studying both critical theory and fine arts with a variety of professors at California College of the Arts, UC Berkeley and Stanford.

Early in childhood, I was introduced to computer science and the use of original algorithms to reach consistent results. In the seminal years of computer history, my father began the high level design of the first international computer network for food distribution. He later led the team that developed and implemented this system when technological innovations matched his aspirations. Inspired by my father's drawings of bar codes and stories about a future of food distribution to everyone in the world based on the bar code, reducibility became my natural way of problem-solving.

I am particularly interested in utilizing the philosophy and mathematics of computer science as the basis for a revolution in social science, particularly philosophy of mind, which always has been left to vague levels of abstraction with no result of permanent benefit. I apply precise levels of organization and explanation used in computer science to arrive at specific results in the philosophy of mind. Advancing theories of information, reducibility, organization and explanation, I developed a comparative analysis and then a comprehensive map of all known systems of education in the nature of mind and in human nature.

Our team consists of friends of Clean Conscience Canada that have joined our mission for a healthier, more sustainable planet for generations to come.

teams.name: Dermalogica
teams.loan_because:
NEWS! In honor of International Women's Day, if you join our team, then make a loan and credit our team, we'll match your loan with one of our own!!*

We believe in the multiplier effect of supplying capital to women - supporting a woman in opening or growing a business enables her to buy food and housing for her family, send her children to school, and contribute to the welfare of her community.  We want to help put more women on the road to Financial Independence Through Entrepreneurship. Join the FITE!
* We'll match up to 3,000 loans.
teams.description: Dermalogica is the number one line of skin care products for professional skin therapists and consumers worldwide.

teams.name: So Sew Easy ladies
teams.loan_because: We want to help women all around the world be successful in their sewing business and support their families.
teams.description: We are a group of ladies who love to sew and share a common interest in sewing both for pleasure or for business.  We came together via the So Sew Easy sewing blog.

teams.name: Airbnb
teams.loan_because: We are good hosts in the community.  We believe that we should be generous, hospitable, and anticipate the needs of others.  We understand that every frame matters in microlending -- small, unique and essential contributions can make a world of difference in others lives!
teams.description: Team Airbnb is a group of Airbnb employees, friends, and supporters that embrace the adventure of microlending!  We seek to use our collective community resources to touch lives globally and support the continued development of the microfinance movement.
